Pre-Game Insights: West Indies are well covered in all departments with several all-rounders and big-hitters, capable of swinging games, adding to their x-factor.
If they start well, the co-hosts will be favourites to top the group.
New Zealand are well prepared for the event with 36 T20Is under their belt since the end of the last T20 World Cup, the most among full-member teams.
Afghanistan are ranked 10th in the ICC Men’s T20I Team Rankings, but are more than capable of pulling off big wins.
Uganda have a stellar record leading up to the tournament with 41 wins in their last 49 T20Is, a win percentage of 83.67 percent.
Papua New Guinea maintained an unbeaten record in the qualifiers, winning six consecutive matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies and New Zealand are the top-ranked teams in Group C, but will face strong resistance from Afghanistan, Uganda and Papua New Guinea as they aim to make it through to the second round.

The surprise inclusion in their squad for the tournament was Shamar Joseph, uncapped in T20Is until featuring against South Africa recently, but clearly a supreme talent in the making as he showed in Australia during the Test series at the start of the year.
Rachin Ravindra hit 15 fours and a six in his 108
Others: The ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024 anthem is 'Out of this World' by Sean Paul and Kes
